conclusion: Analyze the motion of oil droplets in presence of air resistance and electric fields to determine k.
Two spherical oil droplets A and B are located on the same vertical line between two plates.
Droplets fall with uniform velocity v1 before electric field is applied; mg = k m0^(1/3) v1.
Voltage U is applied creating electric field E = U/d; droplet B moves upwards with velocity v2.
For B moving upwards: qE = mg + k m0^(1/3) v2.
Droplet B rises through distance h2 in time t with uniform velocity v2 = h2/t.
B merges with A forming new droplet with mass 2m0; new droplet reaches uniform velocity v3.
Forces balance for combined droplet: qE = mg + k (2m0)^(1/3) v3.
Since A continues to fall at same speed: v1 = v3.
From initial condition: mg = k m0^(1/3) v1.
Using equilibrium for B: qE = mg + k m0^(1/3) v2.
Substitute v2 = h2/t and solve for k: k m0^(1/3) v1 = qU/d - mg.
Since v1 = h1/t: k m0^(1/3) h1/t = qU/d - mg.
Solve for k: k = (d/U) ((h2/h1) - 1) (m0 g / m0^(1/3) h1/t).
